items.name: The Ancestral Stone Tomb of Chief Kaimba
items.short_description: A revered ancient stone burial site believed to house the remains of Chief Kaimba, a legendary figure whose spirit protects the Bomi region. Pilgrims visit to offer prayers for guidance and blessings from the ancestors.

items.name: Mount Nimba's Spirit Peak
items.short_description: Though largely a nature reserve, a specific, less-visited peak within the Liberian side of the Mount Nimba range is revered by local communities as a dwelling place of powerful nature spirits and ancestors. It's a site for annual community rituals.

items.name: The Whispering Rocks of Grand Bassa
items.short_description: A formation of ancient, weathered rocks in Grand Bassa, believed to be an ancient oracle site where community elders historically sought guidance from ancestral spirits through sacred rituals. Locals still believe the wind passing through the rocks carries whispers of prophecy.
items.address: Grand Bassa County, near Buchanan, Liberia

items.name: The Eternal Healing Spring of Lofa
items.short_description: Tucked deep within the forests of Lofa County, this pristine spring is revered for its crystal-clear waters believed to possess powerful healing properties. Locals and spiritual seekers travel great distances to drink from its source and perform purification rituals.
